parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead or carry about (or around), go about, traverse. From peri and ago; to take around; reflexively, to walk around.
A circle, ring. As if dative case of kuklos; i.e. In a circle, i.e. all around.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.
